page.title: 06Religion (cont)
page.content: The east door has been there more than seven hundred years. Cromwell's army rested there once. They open the west door for marragies. Through the door on the right is a font. The seats are three centuries old but they have some new chairs now. In the church it can seat two hundred comfortably. Fifty people go to the {U.R.C.}of which twenty are children. The church has an organ. There is only one church in{Rushton}as the old church,{St.Peter's}was demolished in 1799. The church is well attended and it plays an active part in the life of the village.
